items.title: Steve Bannon floats idea of Bessent running both Treasury and the Fed
items.description: White House confidante Steve Bannon has an unusual solution for who should take over as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell next year.

items.title: Germany was billed as Europe's growth driver. Now economists are saying: Not so fast
items.description: Germany was a hub of excitement earlier this year amid high hopes of an economic rebound â€” domestically, and across Europe.

items.title: Hassett says Fed made 'prudent call,' signaling White House OK with quarter-point cut
items.description: In a CNBC interview Thursday, Hassett noted that the administration, and new Fed Governor Stephen Miran, had been pushing for a bigger reduction.

items.title: Sales of heavy trucks are falling like the U.S. is headed for a recession
items.description: Heavy trucks sales have dropped to levels not seen in four years, according to the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis.

items.title: Sticky UK inflation unlikely to move the needle for Bank of England
items.description: The Bank of England is watching inflation data closely after forecasting the consumer price index could peak at 4% in September.
